36:["$","p",null,{"children":["SvelteKit leverages ",["$","strong",null,{"children":"Svelte's compile-time philosophy"}],", where components are compiled into highly optimized vanilla JavaScript at build time. This eliminates the need for a virtual DOM and results in smaller bundle sizes and faster runtime performance."]}]
37:["$","p",null,{"children":["$","strong",null,{"children":"Key Technologies:"}]}]
38:["$","ul",null,{"children":["\n",["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Vite"}]," as development server and build tool"]}],"\n",["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"O(1) hot reload"}]," that processes only changed files"]}],"\n",["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Filesystem-based routing"}]," with ",["$","code",null,{"children":"src/routes"}]," folder structure"]}],"\n",["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Compile-time optimizations"}]," for maximum efficiency"]}],"\n"]}]

3a:["$","p",null,{"children":["Next.js 13+ introduced the ",["$","strong",null,{"children":"App Router"}]," architecture built around ",["$","strong",null,{"children":"React Server Components (RSC)"}],". This revolutionary approach divides components into server and client types:"]}]
3b:["$","p",null,{"children":["$","strong",null,{"children":"Component Types:"}]}]
3c:["$","ul",null,{"children":["\n",["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Server Components"}]," (default): Rendered on server, can access databases directly"]}],"\n",["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Client Components"}],": Marked with ",["$","code",null,{"children":"\"use client\""}]," directive, handle user interactions"]}],"\n",["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"RSC Payload"}],": Compact binary representation for component reconciliation"]}],"\n"]}]

88:["$","p",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Bottom Line:"}]," SvelteKit offers superior performance and developer experience with compile-time optimizations, while Next.js provides a mature ecosystem with extensive tooling. SvelteKit is simpler to learn and more efficiently designed, making it ideal for performance-critical applications and teams prioritizing developer experience."]}]
